channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Kaylee-Jayde Priest: Mother and boyfriend convicted of manslaughter
item.description: Kaylee-Jayde Priest's grandmother said she was "stolen from me in the most brutal of ways".

item.title: Aya Hachem: Men jailed for student's drive-by murder
item.description: Aya Hachem was "in the wrong place at the wrong time" when she was shot in a feud between tyre firms.

item.title: London riots: 'My shop was burned down but we came back stronger'
item.description: Trevor Reeves and Bushra Ahmed both lost businesses during a night of violence in August 2011.

item.title: Afghan war: I can still hear my cry, says mother of dead soldier
item.description: As fighting in Afghanistan rages, the BBC speaks to the mother of a British soldier who died there nearly 10 years ago.

item.title: Bournemouth beach closed after 'large animal' spotted in sea
item.description: Visitors say there was a shark sighting, though lifeguards were unable to identify the animal.

item.title: Coronavirus: PM and transport secretary defend travel changes
item.description: British tourists in Mexico who are due back after Sunday's deadline will need to decide whether to come home early to avoid quarantining.

item.title: Dea-John Reid: Five people deny murdering boy, 14
item.description: Two men and three teenagers plead not guilty over the death of Dea-John Reid.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Max Whitlock gets hero's welcome at gym club
item.description: The gold medallist performed backflips for cheering crowds on his return from Tokyo.

item.title: Weston shanty festival benefits from Covid call-off
item.description: Due to be held in 2020, the Weston Shanty Festival hopes to ride the wave of interest in the genre.

item.title: Channel crossings: Hundreds more migrants reach UK after record day
item.description: According to Home Office figures, there have now been 10,711 arrivals in 449 boats so far in 2021.

item.title: Northumberland Santa impersonator sentenced for sexual assaults
item.description: Raymond Finn was given a suspended jail sentence for assaulting the two women while in costume.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government has updated its red, amber and green lists of countries.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Covid rules: What has changed?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The government is expected to announce that 16 and 17-year-olds will receive the Covid vaccine.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Nottingham phone thieves distracted victims by dancing
item.description: Police say the men pretended to be drunk to distract their student victims.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Wolverhampton proud of Ben Whittaker
item.description: Friends and family in Wolverhampton couldn't be prouder of the silver medallist.

item.title: Covid: Wigan nurse's photos capture life in intensive care unit
item.description: Nurse Petro Bekker's photos of her team in the intensive care unit are to feature in an exhibition.

item.title: Wigan family rescue deer from drowning in canal
item.description: Chris and Denver Kendall, from Wigan, tied two dog leads together to pull the animal to safety.

item.title: Dog-snatching thief filmed by doorbell camera in Horndean
item.description: A 13-year-old boy was walking his border terrier Melchy when he was pushed out of the way.

item.title: Oatly loses trademark battle against Glebe Farm over oat milk
item.description: Cambridgeshire's Glebe Farm Foods PureOaty drink does not copy the Oatly branding, a judge rules.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: 'Extra special' as twins, say Gadirova sisters
item.description: Jessica and Jennifer Gadirova, 16, return to Britain after securing team bronze in the gymnastics.

item.title: Ever Given: Ship that blocked Suez Canal leaves Felixstowe
item.description: The Ever Given leaves Felixstowe after 2,000 containers were unloaded.

item.title: Holborn crash: Doctor killed in HGV collision 'was on way to patients'
item.description: Dr Marta Krawiec, 41, "died on her way to her patients", her family has said.

item.title: Family pleads for return of therapy dog stolen from Derbyshire kennels
item.description: Elvis, a cockapoo, was stolen from a Derbyshire kennels along with two other dogs.

item.title: Liverpool add Hillsborough's 97th victim to Anfield memorial
item.description: Andrew Devine died last month 32 years after sustaining life-changing injuries at Hillsborough.

item.title: London riots: Youth services cut in half since unrest
item.description: London's young people have missed out on £240m of investment over the last 10 years, figures show.

item.title: Greater Manchester Police officer in court accused of sexual assaults
item.description: Mohammed Adnan Ali, 35, faces 21 charges including five sexual assaults between 2015 and 2018.

item.title: Driver finds escaped lizard in car
item.description: A driver made the unusual discovery and called the RSPCA for help.

item.title: Anderson leads England fightback against India
item.description: James Anderson spearheads an exhilarating England recovery before the weather curtails the second day of the first Test against India.

item.title: The Hundred: Manchester Originals shock Southern Brave in women's competition
item.description: The previously winless Manchester Originals produce the shock of the women's Hundred so far to beat the unbeaten Southern Brave in a rain-affected game at Emirates Old Trafford.

item.title: Jofra Archer: England bowler to miss T20 World Cup and Ashes
item.description: England fast bowler Jofra Archer will miss this winter's T20 World Cup and the Ashes tour of Australia with a stress facture of the elbow.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB's Matt Walls wins omnium gold
item.description: Team GB cyclist Matt Walls is crowned Olympic champion on his debut with a dominant performance in the men's omnium.
